flawed_nl_solution:
Joe can buy a game for $50 and sell it for $30, so he is losing $50 - $30 = $<<50-30=30>>30 each month when he buys and sells a game.
Joe starts out with $240 and he buys a game and sells a game he loses $30 per month, so it will take $240/$30 = <<240/30=8>>8 months until he is out of money.
#### 8

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 30. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
